column4: two options for you: iTunes has silver in Wine's DB now, OR use VirtualBox (w/USB support) to create a MS VM (if you have a legal copy)

assuming you have AMD, then yes - svm = virtualization in CPU.  In order to enable it in VBox, open the properties of your VM -- System / Acceleration tab and be sure Enable VT-x/AMD-V has a checkmark
what does that due then devote a core to the virtual machine?
mainly having CPU Virtualization speeds things up, as well as allows OS that wouldn't load to load
